sense.name: Purposfully move over something with pressure, possibly while applying a substance.
sense.commentary: Includes: RUB IN, RUB DOWN Syntax Includes: NP1[animate] RUB NP2[patient] NP1[animate] RUB IN NP2[patient] (PP{P NP[location]})
sense.examples: Rub my hands please. They're so cold. She rubbed massage oil into my skin before beginning. Don't rub your insect bites. He rubbed his hands all over her body. You have to rub it in to make it work. He rubbed down his client for over an hour.

sense.name: Be in a rubbing relationship with something, causing friction.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[theme] RUB (NP2[patient]) (ADVP[manner]) NP1[theme] RUB PP{P NP2[location]} Note: Unlike Sense 1, although NP1 is in motion, it does not move itself. The rubbing action is a result of the motion of an NP2, explicit or not.
sense.examples: My sweater rubs me sore. This bra rubs at the shoulders.

sense.name: Gradually wear away.
sense.examples: The letters slowly rubbed down/off until the note was not longer legible. She rubbed off the Xs on her hands and started to drink. The soles of my shoes have rubbed down to nothing.

sense.name: Remove by or as if by manually erasing.
sense.examples: We have to rub out the sins of our forefathers and start anew. Please rub out the formula on the blackboard - it's wrong!

sense.name: RUB (UP) THE WRONG WAY: upset through one's actions.
sense.examples: That joke really rubbed me the wrong way. The date was horrible. His every action rubbed her the wrong way. That just rubs me up the wrong way!

sense.name: RUB ONE OUT: masturbate; may be figurative.
sense.examples: Paul rubbed one out in the bathroom before class. She rubbed one out before retiring to bed. It was as if he had rubbed one out in the legislation - he was getting everything he wanted and more!

sense.name: RUB ALONG: manage one's existence barely.
sense.examples: We rubbed along for a few years before finding better jobs. I guess I can rub along on this lousy salary.

sense.name: RUB: call to memory or consciousness.
sense.examples: My session today rubbed up some old issues. That dream last night rubbed up my childhood fear of rejection.

sense.name: pass a quality or characteristic on
sense.examples: His enthusiasm rubbed off on his son. The moonbats have rubbed off on me.
